name: AngularJS
description: A quick reference of AngularJS directives

Directives.val: Use this directive to force the angular.element library
Angular has some feature that can break CSP(Content Security Policy)rules
The ngClick directive allows you to specify custom behavior when an element is clicked
This directive sets the disabled attribute on the element if the expression inside ngDisabled evaluates to truthy
The ngMousedown directive allows you to specify custom behavior on mousedown event
